name: iscrng
body: |- wb(wcel(c0, ccrg), wa(wcel(c0, crg), wcel(c1, ccmn)))

stmt.origin: elrab2(hs0, c0, ccrg, crg, wcel(c1, ccmn), wcel(cfv(cmgp, cv(hs0)), ccmn))
stmt.pretty: elrab2(hs0, c0, ccrg, crg, c1 ∈ CMnd, (mulGrp ` hs0)∈ CMnd)

body.origin:

-| diffsc(hs0, c0)
-| diffsc(hs0, crg)
-| diffsw(hs0, wcel(c1, ccmn))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ CRing ↔(c0 ∈ Ring ∧ c1 ∈ CMnd))
⊣ (hs0 = c0 →((mulGrp ` hs0)∈ CMnd ↔ c1 ∈ CMnd))
⊣ CRing = { hs0 ∈ Ring |(mulGrp ` hs0)∈ CMnd }
⊣ d(hs0, c0)
⊣ d(hs0, Ring)
⊣ d(hs0, c1 ∈ CMnd)

comment: A commutative ring is a ring whose multiplication is a commutative monoid. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 7-Jan-2015.)
